verses.text_plain: Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
verses.verse_html: 1Plead my cause, O Lord, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.

verses.text_plain: Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.
verses.verse_html: 2Take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.

verses.text_plain: Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.
verses.verse_html: 3Draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that persecute me: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

verses.text_plain: Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.
verses.verse_html: 4Let them be confounded and put to shame that seek after my soul: let them be turned back and brought to confusion that devise my hurt.

verses.text_plain: Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord chase them.
verses.verse_html: 5Let them be as chaff before the wind: and let the angel of the Lord chase them.

verses.text_plain: Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the Lord persecute them.
verses.verse_html:
6Let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the Lord persecute them. ▼
▼ dark…: Heb. darkness and slipperiness

footnotes.body_html: ▼ dark…: Heb. darkness and slipperiness

verses.text_plain: For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.
verses.verse_html: 7For without cause have they hid for me their net in a pit, which without cause they have digged for my soul.

verses.text_plain: Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall.
verses.verse_html:
8Let destruction come upon him at unawares; and let his net that he hath hid catch himself: into that very destruction let him fall. ▼
▼ at…: Heb. which he knoweth not of

footnotes.body_text: ▼ at…: Heb. which he knoweth not of
footnotes.body_html: ▼ at…: Heb. which he knoweth not of

verses.text_plain: And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
verses.verse_html: 9And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

verses.text_plain: All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?
verses.verse_html: 10All my bones shall say, Lord, who is like unto thee, which deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor and the needy from him that spoileth him?

tokens.text: from him that is too strong

verses.text_plain: False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not.
verses.verse_html:
11False witnesses did rise up; they laid to my charge things that I knew not. ▼
▼ False…: Heb. Witnesses of wrong
 , ▼
▼ they…: Heb. they asked me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ False…: Heb. Witnesses of wrong
▼ they…: Heb. they asked me

verses.text_plain: They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul.
verses.verse_html:
12They rewarded me evil for good to the spoiling of my soul. ▼
▼ spoiling: Heb. depriving

verses.text_plain: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
verses.verse_html:
13But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom. ▼
▼ humbled: or, afflicted

tokens.text: But as for me, when they were sick

verses.text_plain: I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.
verses.verse_html:
14I behaved myself as though he had been my friend or brother: I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother. ▼
▼ behaved myself: Heb. walked
 , ▼
▼ as though…: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ behaved myself: Heb. walked

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as though…: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as though…: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me

verses.text_plain: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not:
verses.verse_html:
15But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together: yea, the abjects gathered themselves together against me, and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceased not: ▼
▼ adversity: Heb. halting

verses.text_plain: With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
verses.verse_html: 16With hypocritical mockers in feasts, they gnashed upon me with their teeth.

verses.text_plain: Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions.
verses.verse_html:
17Lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescue my soul from their destructions, my darling from the lions. ▼
▼ darling: Heb. only one

tokens.text: how long wilt thou look on

footnotes.body_html: ▼ darling: Heb. only one

verses.text_plain: I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people.
verses.verse_html:
18I will give thee thanks in the great congregation: I will praise thee among much people. ▼
▼ much: Heb. strong

verses.text_plain: Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.
verses.verse_html:
19Let not them that are mine enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause. ▼
▼ wrongfully: Heb. falsely

tokens.text: Let not them that are mine enemies

verses.text_plain: For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.
verses.verse_html: 20For they speak not peace: but they devise deceitful matters against them that are quiet in the land.

verses.text_plain: Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.
verses.verse_html: 21Yea, they opened their mouth wide against me, and said, Aha, aha, our eye hath seen it.

verses.text_plain: This thou hast seen, O Lord: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.
verses.verse_html: 22This thou hast seen, O Lord: keep not silence: O Lord, be not far from me.

verses.text_plain: Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.
verses.verse_html: 23Stir up thyself, and awake to my judgment, even unto my cause, my God and my Lord.

verses.text_plain: Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.
verses.verse_html: 24Judge me, O Lord my God, according to thy righteousness; and let them not rejoice over me.

verses.text_plain: Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up.
verses.verse_html:
25Let them not say in their hearts, Ah, so would we have it: let them not say, We have swallowed him up. ▼
▼ Ah…: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Ah…: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Ah…: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul

verses.text_plain: Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.
verses.verse_html: 26Let them be ashamed and brought to confusion together that rejoice at mine hurt: let them be clothed with shame and dishonour that magnify themselves against me.

verses.text_plain: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
verses.verse_html:
27Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the Lord be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant. ▼
▼ righteous…: Heb. righteousness

verses.text_plain: And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
verses.verse_html: 28And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness and of thy praise all the day long.
